title: POCO F1 (Steel Blue, 256 GB)  (8 GB RAM)

product_specification.In The Box: Handset, Adapter, USB Cable, Warranty Card, User Guide, SIM Insertion Tool, Back Case
product_specification.Primary Camera Features: Dual Rear Camera with Primary 6p Lens and Secondary 4p Lens, f/1.9 Primary Aperture and f/2.0 Secondary Aperture, Dual Rear Camera with 6-element Primary Lens and 4-element Secondary Lens
product_specification.Secondary Camera Features: IR Front Camera with f/2.0 Aperture
product_specification.Sensors: Gyroscope, Proximity, Accelerometer, Ambient Light Sensor
product_specification.Other Features: 10 nm Architecture Processor, Battery Power Rating - 9V/2A
product_specification.Warranty Summary: Brand Warranty of 1 Year Available for Mobile and 6 Months for Accessories

product_description.Performance - Beat This!: Enjoy an unbeatable performance on a low power consumption, courtesy the phone's Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 mobile platform. You get Snapdragon's powerful AI engine on an advanced flagship 10nm class chip - work, game, or multi-task, everything is seamless.
product_description.LiquidCool Technology: Normally reserved for hardcore gaming smartphones, this technology keeps the POCO F1's CPU cool. Its Snapdragon 845 processor maintains its peak performance and boasts a high frequency output no matter how intensely you game.
product_description.Full-day Battery Charge: Juice up your phone quickly; it supports the Quick Charge 3.0 system which replenishes the battery's power in no time. Once fully charged, its 4000 mAh lithium polymer battery powers up to 30 hours of calling and up to 146 hours of audio playback.
product_description.Picture-perfect Shots: The 12 MP + 5 MP dual rear camera system features dual pixel autofocus and a large 1.4 micrometer pixel sensor in the primary lens. These come together to deliver pictures with enhanced brightness, clarity, and quality. This camera's autofocus speed along with EIS (Electronic Image Stabilisation) and Hardware multi-frame noise reduction is commendable, especially while clicking pictures which are in motion or in low-light conditions.
product_description.AI Scene Detection: The AI cameras intelligently distinguish across 206 scenes and automatically adjust the exposure, saturation in media files, and make other photo optimizations. The POCO F1 packs an additional Scene Detection feature that's designed specially for the Indian smartphone user.
product_description.High-res Front Camera: The 20 MP high-res sensor coupled with the 4-in-1 Super Pixel technology (2 micrometer-large pixel) in the front camera gives you selfies which are as good as they can get. It's time to revamp your Instagram page with studio-like shots; thanks to the AI Beautify 4.0 and the Bokeh Effect feature.
product_description.Lighter, Faster, and Smoother with MIUI: Tailor-made for POCO, MIUI (user interface) equips this phone with a turbocharged engine to give you a faster performance, more sensitive swipe movements, and a lot more such benefits. The customizable App Drawer for POCO Launcher intelligently categorises your apps so searching for them is simple and quick. MIUI for POCO is also tasked with the work of securing your phone with the latest patches and updates from Google.
product_description.IR Face Unlock: Access your phone's contents without touching it. Infrared light on the device's camera identifies your face and unlocks the phone even in the dark.
product_description.If Looks Could Kill: The POCO F1 uses the same Kevlar armed fibre which is used for applications in aviation, military, and high-end cycling. This design detailing gives the phone a sophisticated texture and ensures you a firm grip on it, whilst also protecting the device from everyday wear and tear.
product_description.One Phone, Two Ports: Other than the required type-C charging port, this phone features a 3.5 mm audio port.
product_description.A Full Screen Display: Enjoy an intuitive and immersive viewing experience on its 18.7:9 edge-to-edge display. Protected by the renowned Corning Gorilla Glass, its 15.69 cm (6.18) Full-HD+ screen is built to last.
product_description.An Expansive Internal Storage: Now store as many songs and photos on your phone as you want. This smartphone comes with up to 256 GB of ROM.

For the price of Rs25.5k (after offer + CC cashback), this 8GB+256GB+Kevlar back one is no-brainer.
[1] Finally a phone, I can use without a case. The soft touch feel of kevlar is simply mind-blowing..
[2] Android Pie 9.0 is also buttery smooth (but dis-allows hiding notch. But there natcho-notch app comes to the rescue).
[3] Love the xiaomi's gestures to use full screen for myself, removing the nav buttons.
[4] Battery life is also more than good for 1.5 days.
[5] Display is awesome.
[6] Camera is far better than my expectations.
[7] IR cam assisted face unlock works great even in pitch dark.
[8] finger print scanner is super fast.
[9] Phone charges fast enough and notification LED down is a good addition as well.
[10] Dual VoLTE works great. Supports all 4G network's VoLTE, including Airtel and Idea.
[11] LTE+ or LTE-A or LTE Carrier aggregation works great. May be 2CA. Mostly like (Band 40+ Band 40) and (Band 3 + Band 40) combinations.
[12] Loud Speaker and call quality is also good.

TERRIFIC PURCHASE !!

I still have my return period going on and this is something super amazing. I changed my S9 with this and my motive was that processors are pretty same and I didn't wanted to downgrade and was short on cash too.

Pros:
1. Snapdragon 845 2.8 Gigahertz, the best in class
2. People hate the screen but I'm in love with the same.
3. 4000 mah battery which is amazingly tuned with the performance.
4. Liquid Cooling System, phone barely heats up.
5. I have the 8GB/256gb variant as compared to S9 which had only 4GB/64gb and was sloppy with just 144 apps in it. I got extra space and extra fast performance.
6. The face recognition is just amazing, unlocks the phone even in the complete darkness.
7. Adreno 630 which I had same in Galaxy S9.

Cons:
1. MiUI just because I love stock android/OneUI
2. Camera is okayish and could be amazing, wil start to use GoogleCam for the same.
3. Need to tweak the UI a little bit.
4. Netflix Certification not provided to forget to watch the same in HD.

Verdict:
1. For UI related stuff, kindly get "Rootless Pixel Launcher". (temporary stock android feel+no ads)
2. For screen, kindly get "Matte Screen Guard", touches improve over time.
3. Don't get hard case, can end up putting scratches at the back. (get a leather case)
4. As compared to OnePlus 6 / OnePlus 6T, the benchmark is higher, even higher than Samsung S9's performance.
5. Value for money, giving up Super AMOLED does hurt, but that's fine, there's no issue like screen-bleeding, etc.
6. UI is interactive but can be amazing if tweaked to get stock android. (trying on the same)
7. Camera is okayish but I'm a performance loving person, for me the camera doesn't matter, the performance does.

I got the 8gb RAM/256gb ROM Armored edition variant. I am really starting to love the phone at this price point. Here's my pros, cons, could be better:
Pros:
Performance: This phone is a BEAST with Snapdragon 845 chipset. Graphics intensive PUBG game ran super smooth with all high settings. I saw this as a single most point as worth buying under this price along with high RAM. Liquid cooling tech really kept the back of phone from heating at all.
Battery: Big on battery 4000mah. Not a 2-day battery but I could still see around 23% charge remaining after a full day use. Impressive!
Display: An FHD IPS display yet feels somewhat AMOLED like with vibrant colours and sharp images. Don't expect Galaxy S9 flagship like display though!
MiUi 10: Comes with Android Oreo. Phone was shipped with MiUi 9 skin which I didn't like at first as I heard there were quite some issues with it. But MiUi 10 is available to update and it has fixed most of the issues and made the UI more sleek, simple and modern. A big thumbs up for that. Android Pie should be available in coming months.
Camera: I expected Poco to cut the corners in camera section. But I don't think it's that bad at all. Instead I felt the 12mp+5mp rear dual camera was quite good enough under good light conditions. Some noise creeped in during low light shots but I found photos decent enough. selfie camera came with 20mp and it's AI did a fair job in portrait mode.
Fingerprint sensor: Blazing fast. Trust me!
Face ID: Didn't try because of Fingerprint sensor.

Cons:
Hybrid Sim: Its either 2 sim cards OR 1 sim + 1 SD card! My old Moto X Play supported all 3 at once. Hence I went with the 256gb variant.
The Infamous display Notch: Yeah I know it looks stylish & premium and all. But I wished the 2 notches could have been a bit more wider so it could accommodate at least some notification icons.
No HD content in Netflix and Prime: Yes! you heard that right! This is due to something known as DRM and a phone needs L1 certification to play 1080p on streaming services. Xiaomi unfortunately has L3. So you will be able to play only upto 540p videos which I feel is still manageable for me because I don't do a lot of Netflix/Prime.
I am however a YouTube junkie and I'm glad YouTube runs on 1080p.

Could be improved:
Providing Google now launcher support: Currently shows it isn't compatible in playstore. I am a fan of stock android experience. Simple design, just feels fast and right to use, no bloatwares etc. MiUi 10 isn't bad itself considering how much it has improved over time. But the Mi bloatwares still persist. Some may be useful, some may not.
Build: I own the armoured version which comes with Kevlar finish back which looks cool. Surrounding it is still plastic. But It does feel very good and solidly built in hand.
No NFC: This tech is used for Android Pay in supermarkets of the west. But it's not prominent in India yet. So I'm okay with it being not there.
Screen rounded too much at the bottom corners. That's quite some screen real estate shaved off.

I perfectly understand Poco cutting some corners here and there for that aggressive price range they are selling but I'm so much thankful to them not doing it in the areas where it mattered the most.

So Should you buy it?? If you are thinking of mainly budget and performance then I honestly cannot think of any other phone, but just this one. Just go for it!

This phone is superb. In the Republic sale, I got this phone for 15.5 K for 8GB / 256 GB and believe me its super-duper excellent for this price. Even the recently matched X2 won't be able to match the speed with this Poco X1 845 processor.

But one thing to note, the manufactured date I got for this phone was of Sep 2018, so its a 1 1/2-year-old phone. Please note that.

But with the flagship processor, you get flagship performance in terms of Cellular connectivity, Wifi Connectivity, camera performance, and all those nitty-gritty details.

One thing for sure, you cannot get 8GB / 256 GB for the price. And of course, this review is for the people who are satisfied with the performance of the phone rather than showing off. If you are of the Show off type, you can buy new non-flagship phones at prices costlier than this Poco F1

The software update is latest on the phone, Offers Vo-WiFi calling. Camera performance is excellent, device response is snap.

Go for it if Purely performance is what matters to you most, you cannot get a better device than this phone with the specs for this price

I am using my POCO F1 for last 6 months. This phone is absolute beast you can do anything thing seamlessly from clicking photographs to playing games.

Pros:
1. Camera
It is a flagship quality you can take awesome photo using the default cam app. You can even install gcam for better photographs.
2. RAM
8 Gb ram makes your day to day work easy with it you get a better ram management.
3. Storage
With 256Gb of internal storage you have worry less about running out of storage space anytime soon.
4. Looks
its quite basic if you compare it with the phones launch in past year but it is sturdy an survive fall from upto few feet . The Kevlar back panel gives it a premium look. It is quite big phone if you have never used a phone with a over 5 inch screen
5. Display
The colors are very vibrant and has sharp display. Everything in screen looks detail. Good for watching movies and playing games. The touch response is smooth with quick reaction times
6. Battery
4000mah is quite decent if you are regular user it will definitely last for a day. But with gaming it will last for about variable time if you are a hardcore mobile gaming lover. So you have to recharge your phone often. Type C fast charging is available so charging is pretty fast you can expect 0 - 100% in about 1hr 30 mins or may be less mine takes about an hour.
7. Gaming
If your a mobile gaming enthusiast. This is definitely the deal for your. Without any hesitation you can opt for this device. You will not be disappointed. Believe me.

Cons:

It might be hard to believe but so far no cons have been found by me. For me it exceeds expectations.

Well where do I start with this phone. There are so many good things to talk about Poco F1.
1.Rear Camera - The inbuilt camera app itself comes with so many features (panaroma, portrait, manual, slow Mo, night mode) and the picture quality is amazing. Night mode is something that caught my attention as it really picks up the colours brilliantly even at low light.
2.Front camera - A really great selfie camera for pictures and video calling.
3.Performance - Well you can expect the phone to function as an 8 GB ram phone with me not facing a single lag issue.
4.Battery - Takes up to 1.5 hrs to charge upto 99% and the phone even at high activity range, lasts you the entire day. I am really impressed by the battery life for video playback.
5.Speaker - In the absence of a portable speaker it is quite impressive to even enjoy music on the phone speaker. High volume causes a little irritation but at a normal volume the inbuilt speaker is really great.
6.UI - The UI is the standard MI UI which is quite easy to use and also looks attractive.
7.Display - The screen being a LCD display, it still has really great colour density and clarity. To be honest I have dropped my phone a couple of times but still not a single crack or scratch, regardless of me not using a scratch guard. Would recommend using a phone protection cover to be safe.

Few bugs still need to be fixed in the UI and also not completely satisfied with the portrait mode on the camera app.

I purchased this product in good faith and soon enough trouble started. It works only with my male deep bass low frequency voice. When my wife speaks, the calls have drops, with her voice cut out! How can one live with a shoddy product like this!? Next, it has problems in connecting via a USB cable with my Macbook Pro.File transfer does not work.The solutions offered by Xiomi service point at Kalkaji Main market downgraded the connection from top level 4G to 3G. Still the problem persists. The simple Samsung mobile purchased in 2016 works without a hitch. No such problems. Costed only around INR 7,500!

One major problem, at least for me is that, it doesn't support google now/google assistant voice feature: "Okay Google". Other users also have reported that it also doesn't allow to use google now launcher, it prompts the message as "Your device doesn't support this feature". so if you want to trigger google assistant you have to long press the home button (Again, if you are using the full screen gestures mode, there is no home button of the screen). Although recent updates in the MI issues page shows that the developers have addressed this issue and have said that they will solve it in the coming software updates.

Secondly, there is no option to disable notch in some apps e.i. the apps which are categorized as "optimized for full screen mode". But some apps(games) like PUBG Mobile are definitely not optimized for this, a significant amount of portion of gameplay is hindered by the notch, and we cannot do anything about it.

I know these can be solved through software updates, but when the updates will be released is still a mystery :p

Other than these the phone is awesome !

POCO F1 is the "Master of Speed" in every true sense. I got this mobile only recently since i was really not sure if i wanted an Xiaomi Branded product. So let's get down to the nitty gritty of the usage. I am sure most people here must have read all reviews and seen videos on YouTube on this. But i want you to go through my review just in case you are thinking of buying it. It's short and concise.

Pros:
1. Snapdragon 845 + 8GB RAM at 25K is more than you can ask for. On top of it 256GB storage. Full points to Xiaomi on this.
2. It's super fast. I opened 37 apps simultaneously and it still works without breaking a sweat. Benchmarks scores are justified.
3. Games run on full HD without any frame drops whatsoever.
4. Stereo speakers dude !!! The sound is good for a phone at this price.
5. Face unlock is not a gimmick. It works great on this phone even in darkness.
6. Camera is good, but the dynamic range feels off. Editing on snapseed gave me the best results.
7. Battery is a monster and charging speed is good. More work and less charging.

Cons:
1. After using Honor it feels just heavy. The 4000mah battery has made its contribution here.
2. Heats up if you are using a case; charging it and playing games continously.
3. Screen could have been better. Just saying; and the large notch is a bother.
4. MI needs to step up it's UI Game.

If you are thinking between this and One plus 6T (Because that's the competition), then go for this. Period.

Pros & cons for Poco F1 Armoured Edition

Pros :

1) Butter smooth performance in Games and other applications

2) Good rear and front camera

3) Future proof spec

4) Battery life is great. The phone easily last 12 hours of heavy uses.

5) Sound quality is moderate to good

6) Mobile network reception is great

Cons:

1) The phone is bit bulky. One handed use is a no-go

2) MIUI ROM is not good at all for day to day performance. Typing and office app (word/excel) experience is pretty bad.


Final verdict: Poco f1 is a great phone for enthuastics and future proof in many ways; but it will do much good if xiaomi could bring it under Android One program and made it little compact.

A well rounded compact powerhouse with excellent battery.
Pros
* Great Battery life
* Performance is excellent
* Sufficient RAM 6/8gb. RAM management is not bad
* Internal storage is apt along with Micro SD expansion
* Dual 4G and VoLTE - both SIMs run in 4G and both SIMs support VoLTE
* Phone is neatly made.

Cons
* Camera is a disappointment. A minor Software enhancement can go a long way in making the quality better. GCam proves that the camera hardware is good enough, Stable GCam mod only available on root.
* MIUI - although better among other custom UI's, a stock android would be better off, in terms of timely updates as well as usability. Pie came to the device only a few weeks ago so pretty slow updates
* The notch was not needed. The screen has a thick bezel on all sides. The screen quality is sub par - one of the areas cost cutting was done. Its LCD and not AMOLED

Overall a pretty complete package. Great performance in real world scenarios.

For years I had wanted a flagship level phone but was unwilling to spend too much. When OnePlus came, I thought that this was it. But due to budgetary constraint was not able to go for it. A few years later came the Poco F1. I waited for my phone budget to improve. Initially I thought of going for the 6 GB/64 GB one, but I thought that the best hardware offering by Poco would be more suitable, as I had no plans to change my phone for at least a couple more years. So I went for the 8 GB/256 GB Armored Edition. That was the only one that I thought looked like a proper flagship phone.

Now, after using it for a few weeks, I have no regrets about my choice. The phone is a beast with an enormous 4000 mAH battery which gives amazing talk and standby times. I got Antutu score of more 2,65,000. Keeping that aside, in day-to-day tasks it is comparable to my iPad in smoothness (that says everything).

This is one phone that no one would regret buying.

The phone itself is impressive with it's price point and the features it's offering, the only downside I feel personally is MIUI but I installed the pixel experience ROM and now the phone looks stunning.
CAMERA:
As per the camera it's a decent one for the price, but you will find a real difference in the performance when you use Google camera app. It takes surprisingly detailed shots during the night thanks to hdr+ and night sight.
DISPLAY:
Now for the display it's a FHD+ Panel which is pretty colour accurate, but I found many users complaining about screen bleeding issue on their unit, I agree there is a little bit at the downside of the device which is not noticible in the first place, you need to turn the brightness all the way up and should have a dark background and then you will notice a little bit of screen bleed issue as per my unit it is very little, but you should remember it's an IPS panel not a AMOLED one and moreover they are curving a IPS panel which comes with some compromise ie screen bleeding.
BATTERY:
It comes with a 4000mah battery which easily lasts the whole day with a remaining charge of 20-25%
SPEAKERS:
This is the department where the phone truly amazed me, it is a stereo setup and honestly it sounds better than one plus 6.
GAMING:
This phone is built around the concept of gaming with a copper heat pipe inside which helps to maintain a stable frame rate in whatever game you play and the experience is very good.

NOTE:
This testing was done on pixel experience ROM
for those of who are wondering finger print scanner and IR camera works on this ROM

You probably know what's good about this phone already so I'll just focus on what's bad and why you might want to stay away from this phone.
1. If you are a relatively fast Tyler, the touch responsiveness will disappoint you. It's impossible to type fast unless you turn off haptic feedback on the keyboard.
2. You will miss a lot of your notifications on MiUI and due to the notch you won't be able to see them in your status bar either. Even if you hide the notch the issue still persists.
3. Since the camera has no OIS the night time shots are rather shaky even with Gcam's Night Sight.
4. The display is good except the light bleeding in the bottom.

If those issues don't bother you, or if you are willing to flash custom ROMs then I highly recommend this phone.

Absolute beast when it's pure performance that you are looking for. Can easily punch phones above its price range. Bought the phone for 18k from Flipkart nearly a year back, can't complain anything about the price and completely satisfied from a vfm point of view. The SD845 is a beast and could it with 8GB ram you have a monster performer in hand. Although the display is LCD it's quite good and won't disappoint anyone. The only con I can think of is the huge notch which eats into display but this vanishes when you see how quickly the incorporated IR camera helps you perform face unlock even in pitch darkness.. great phone overall and people who don't buy this thinking that you won't get an update beyond Android 10 / MIUI 12, there are so many custom ROMs available out there for you to try and has already been proven to run Android 11 beta as seen from YouTube videos... So go for this if you don't care about the looks but value performance and solid build quality.. overall one of the best phones ever made, coming from a galaxy note 8 user..

I'm an average user and I find that the Poco F1 does everything I need - FLAWLESSLY. There are some minor bugs which have their fixes coming down the way. Some people may have reported issues with display and all, honestly, mine is just fine. If you have to spend more than 3-4 seconds to spot screen bleeding, your unit is fine. It isn't screen bleeding if you see it on particular colours or angles. I saw people on YouTube expanding their videos and then complaining that the right side of the screen is too rounded. Those are worthless reviews. The default aspect ratio is just fine. Some reported issues with screen touch latency. I did not encounter such a problem. I've typed this on my Poco and it's just fine without any problems. Also, one should not whine if the Porche that they bought for a price of BMW, has some minor issues that is acceptable and/or fixable/serviceable. I also think that there are paid reviews on YouTube and it's just not very reliable unless you extensively watch multiple videos and then take a decision to purchase. I'm also a keen smartphone user and this phone has aptX which is amazing. The Face Unlock is simply THE BEST I've seen. I've got the top model so people are jealous that they got lower specced phones at a premium.
